messages.message:
My crafting environment (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/tonybackend2?cw=dev) seems to be missing libmagic. This anyone else running into something similar?

```
======================================================================
ERROR: instabase_unit_tests.instabase.handler.api.v2.test_search_node_agent (unittest.loader._FailedTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError: Failed to import test module: instabase_unit_tests.instabase.handler.api.v2.test_search_node_agent
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/unittest/loader.py", line 436, in _find_test_path
    module = self._get_module_from_name(name)
  File "/usr/local/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/unittest/loader.py", line 377, in _get_module_from_name
    __import__(name)
  File "/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/test/py/instabase_unit_tests/instabase/handler/api/v2/test_search_node_agent.py", line 6, in <module>
    from instabase_test.webserver.unit import flask_test_util
  File "/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/test/py/instabase_test/webserver/unit/flask_test_util.py", line 20, in <module>
    from instabase.content.filehandle_v2.grpc_file_client import GRPCFileClient, IBFileInterfaceV2
  File "/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/test/py/instabase/content/filehandle_v2/grpc_file_client.py", line 4, in <module>
    import magic
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-R9J_7aBi-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/magic/__init__.py", line 209, in <module>
    libmagic = loader.load_lib()
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-R9J_7aBi-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/magic/loader.py", line 49, in load_lib
    raise ImportError('failed to find libmagic.  Check your installation')
ImportError: failed to find libmagic.  Check your installation```
very possible it needs to be added to the base image, but you can install it yourself with `sudo apt-get install libmagic-dev`
You might need to run `sudo apt-get update` before `sudo apt-get install libmagic-dev` (i had to in my case)
